author: Reuters Editorial
title: Barry Callebaut to boost Ivory Coast cocoa grinding capacity to 230,000 T
text:
ABIDJAN, May 22 (Reuters) - Switzerlandâ€™s Barry Callebaut plans to boost the annual grinding capacity of its facilities in Ivory Coast to 230,000 tonnes from 170,000 tonnes by 2022, CEO Antoine de Saint-Affrique said on state-owned broadcaster RTI.
The company plans to invest around 30 billion CFA francs ($53 million) from next year to increase capacity at its factories in the port cities of Abidjan and San Pedro, he said during a ceremony over the weekend.
$1 = 571.3900 CFA francs Reporting by Ange Aboa Editing by Joe Bavier and Louise Heavens
